intro: Iberis boppardensis, commonly known as the Boppard carnation, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features dense clusters of bright yellow or white flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soils.
